title: Ticket #6371: filetransfer plugins w/ relative dynamic libraries fail if run as root
description:
HTCondor has an option to run your filetransfer plugins as root. (This is not the default and should only be enabled if you need it and know what you are doing!)

In that situation, the plugin is invoked with real uid 0 and effective uid of the user doing the transfer.

If the plugin uses shared libraries that are specified in the binary's RUNPATH relative to $ORIGIN as opposed to absolute paths, the loader will refuse to load them for security reaons when the uid and euid do not match.

There's isn't much HTCondor can do about this other than try to print a helpful message in the log. The sysadmin has the option of installing the necessary shared libraries in a system location such as /usr/lib[64]/. Setting LD_LIBRARY_PATH doesn't do the trick either. Check man page for ld.so, although it's fairly lacking. Search the web for "ld.so setuid shared library" or similar.
